allowPatternMatching.description: Determine whether pattern matching is allowed in a match-case statement. If disabled, the match-case statement is equivalent to the switch-case statement.

defaultCaseSyntax.title: Notation for the default case in a match statement
enumDescriptions: The default case will be written as `case _`. Use by Rust and Python
The default case will be written as `default`. Use by C, C++, and more
The default case will be written as `case *`. `*` is more universally associated to 'match anything' than `_`
Use to refer to its counterpart that can't utilize pattern matching
Use by most languages that has the match/case statement
